p.n: 30 for 30: 30 for 30: Playing For The Mob
p.k: Mobster Henry Hill, made infamous in the movie Goodfellas, helped fix college basketball games. This is a tale of greed, betrayal and reckoning
This week we take a trip down memory lane with Mick McCarthy, and also speak to the first Tanzanian footballer to ever play in the Premier League, Aston
With the race for the Bundesliga title set to go down to the wire yet again this season, take a look at Bayern Munich and Borussia Dortmund's title chances
All the thrills and spills from round four of the 2019 FIM Speedway Grand Prix in Hallstavik, Sweden
The best of the action from round 13 of the Gallagher Premiership, including Bristol Bears v Harlequins, Exeter Chiefs v Bath Rugby and Saracens v Leicester Tigers
Highlights from the fourth round of the 2019 FIA World Rallycross Championship at Silverstone
Highlights from the 2019 Sailing World Cup Series final in Marseille, France
This documentary chronicles the career of Bernadette Locke-Mattox, the first woman to serve as an assistant coach in Division I men's basketball

p.n: SEC Storied: The Bo You Don't Know
p.k: Bo Jackson hit 500-foot home runs and ran over linebackers. This documentary looks at the man considered one of the greatest athletes in history
In 1988, Notre Dame hosted Miami Hurricanes in what was one of the greatest games in college football history. This 30 for 30 documentary tells the story

p.n: 30 for 30: The Band That Wouldn't Die
p.k: This documentary, part of the acclaimed 30 for 30 series, tells the story of how Baltimore's fans coped with losing their NFL team in 1984
ESPN Films takes a look into the story of how the 1969 college football national champion was crowned by President Richard Nixon and the drama that surrounded it

p.n: 30 for 30: ESPN Films: Two Points, One title
p.k: On January 2nd 1984 Nebraska Head Coach Tom Osborne made a coaching decision that decided the fate of two programs in a single play. Part of the ESPN Films series
In 1988, a Texas high school fielded the football team that many consider the greatest ever, yet it's likely you have never heard their story

p.n: 30 for 30: Small Potatoes: Who Killed the USFL?
p.k: Part of the acclaimed 30 for 30 series, this documentary examines Donald Trump's involvement in the demise of the United States Football League in the mid-1980s

p.n: 30 for 30: 30 for 30: The Year of the Scab
p.k: This documentary, part of the acclaimed 30 for 30 series, details the incredible tale of the Washington Redskins' replacement team that played during
With contributions from the sport's biggest names, BT Sport Films offers an extraordinary insight into the mental fortitude required in order to succeed

p.n: 30 for 30: 30 for 30: Ghosts of Ole Miss
p.k: In 1962, the University of Mississippi erupted into violence over integration while swelling with pride over their unbeaten American football team
Ricky Williams recorded himself during his year away from American football. This is the misunderstood athlete's story in his own words
This film uses the case of Steve Bartman - the fan who interfered with an in-play ball in the 2003 NLCS and was vilified for it - to examine scapegoating

p.n: 30 for 30: The Gospel According to Mac
p.k: This 30 for 30 documentary examines Bill McCartney and his sometimes-controversial mixture of American football and evangelicalism as Colorado Buffaloes
